description:
net: consolidate TCP socket option helper files

Just realized that someone created tcpsockopt files that are
good for holding TCP socket option shims between platforms.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

On 2013/07/22 08:38:31, mikio wrote:
> Hello mailto:golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: mailto:golang-dev@googlegroups.com),
> 
> I'd like you to review this change to
> https://code.google.com/p/go

I'm finding it hard to get excited about this change, it's not a net reduction in loc and I'm having trouble following which bits have moved where. I say we leave this CL until a more obvious improvement can be demonstrated.

On Mon, Jul 22, 2013 at 8:23 PM,  <dave@cheney.net> wrote:

> I'm finding it hard to get excited about this change, it's not a net
> reduction in loc and I'm having trouble following which bits have moved
> where. I say we leave this CL until a more obvious improvement can be
> demonstrated.

fair enough, will abandon.

Thank you. Sorry to rain on the parade. 

On 23/07/2013, at 10:49, Mikio Hara <mikioh.mikioh@gmail.com> wrote:

> On Mon, Jul 22, 2013 at 8:23 PM,  <dave@cheney.net> wrote:
> 
>> I'm finding it hard to get excited about this change, it's not a net
>> reduction in loc and I'm having trouble following which bits have moved
>> where. I say we leave this CL until a more obvious improvement can be
>> demonstrated.
> 
> fair enough, will abandon.
> 
> -- 
> 
> ---

On Tue, Jul 23, 2013 at 9:54 AM, Dave Cheney <dave@cheney.net> wrote:

> Sorry to rain on the parade.

It's a early summer rain, let's go in the rain. ;)

subject: code review 11629045: net: consolidate TCP socket option helper files
